title: Quiz 1: Immunization Basics & Schedule
description: Assess your knowledge of KEPI principles, the cold chain, and the Kenya Expanded Programme on Immunization schedule.

questions.question: What is the primary function of the Vaccine Vial Monitor (VVM)?

options.text: To measure the quantity of liquid left in the vial
To warn when a vaccine has been degraded by heat exposure
To indicate the expiration date of the vaccine
To monitor the humidity levels during transport

questions.explanation: The VVM is a heat-sensitive label that changes color to warn health workers when a vaccine vial should be discarded due to cumulative heat exposure.
questions.hint: It relates to the 'Cold Chain' maintenance.

questions.question: Arrange the administration of the following vaccines in the correct chronological order for an infant:
questions.explanation: BCG is at birth, DPT 1st dose at 6 weeks, 2nd dose at 10 weeks, and Measles/Yellow Fever at 9 months.
questions.hint: Start with the vaccine given immediately after delivery.

questions.question: Which of the following diseases are prevented by the Pentavalent (DPT-HepB-Hib) vaccine? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The Pentavalent vaccine covers Diphtheria, Pertussis, Tetanus, Hepatitis B, and Haemophilus influenzae type b.
questions.hint: Think about the components represented by the acronyms in the name.

questions.question: Match the term to its correct definition based on KEPI guidelines:

pairs.right: System maintaining low temps from production to user
Received all antigens + Vitamin A before 1st birthday
Administration of antigenic material to stimulate immunity
Equal access to immunization as a right to health

questions.explanation: Cold chain ensures potency; Fully immunized includes Vit A; Vaccination is the act; Equity is a core principle.
questions.hint: Match the process with its description.

questions.question: The Measles vaccine is administered at ___BLANK___ months, while the 3rd dose of Oral Polio Vaccine (OPV) is given at ___BLANK___ weeks.
questions.explanation: Measles is given at 9 months; OPV sequence is Birth, 6, 10, and 14 weeks.
questions.hint: Measles is late in the first year; OPV 3rd dose coincides with the 3rd Pentavalent dose.

questions.question: According to the Ministry of Health obligations, vaccination services for foreign travel must be provided free of charge.
questions.explanation: Routine vaccination services are free, but those required for foreign travel are offered at a cost.
questions.hint: Consider if travel vaccines are 'routine' for all children.

questions.question: Review the Immunization Schedule table below. Which vaccine is MISSING from the 10th Week schedule?

richContent.content:
AgeVaccines Administered
BirthBCG, OPV
6 WeeksOPV, DPT-HepB-Hib, PCV 10
10 WeeksOPV, DPT-HepB-Hib, [MISSING]

questions.explanation: PCV 10 (Pneumococcal vaccine) is given at the 6th, 10th, and 14th weeks.
questions.hint: It prevents pneumonia and is given alongside Pentavalent.

questions.question: Which principle of the Kenya Expanded Programme on Immunization emphasizes that countries have primary responsibility for governance and providing quality services?
questions.explanation: Country ownership is the principle stating countries have primary ownership and responsibility for governance and service provision.
questions.hint: It implies the program belongs to the nation.

questions.question: According to the guidelines on immunization services, when must unused doses of a liquid multi-dose vial without a preservative be discarded?

richContent.content: Guideline Extract: All vaccines for human use must be stored in specialized medical refrigerators... All unused doses of a liquid multi-dose vial vaccine without a preservative must be discarded...

options.text: At the end of the month

questions.explanation: The manual specifically states that liquid multi-dose vials without preservatives must be discarded 6 hours after opening.
questions.hint: This applies to vaccines like PCV 10.

questions.question: Which of the following are obligations of the Ministry of Health regarding vaccination?

options.text: Provide routine vaccines free of charge
Provide BCG and Birth OPV 7 days a week in maternity units

questions.explanation: The MoH provides free routine vaccines, uses community strategy for uptake, and ensures daily availability of birth doses in maternity units.
questions.hint: Think about access and cost barriers.
